qas.question: What time period marks the start of Neolithic culture?
Where did the Neolithic culture begin?
What food item was the key to the evolution of farming?
What era lasted between 12,000 and 10,200 BC?
What time period marks the start of farming culture?
Where did the Dryas culture begin?
What food item was the key to the evolution of culture?
What era lasted between 13,000 and 8,800 BC?

plausible_answers.text: climatic changes associated with the Younger Dryas

qas.question: What are thought to have forced people to develop culture?

context: The beginning of the Neolithic culture is considered to be in the <a1_0><b5_0>Levant (Jericho, modern-day West Bank)<b5_0/><a1_0/> about <a0_0><b4_0>10,200 – 8,800 BC<b4_0/><a0_0/>. It developed directly from the Epipaleolithic Natufian culture in the region, whose people pioneered the use of <a2_0><b6_0>wild cereals<b6_0/><a2_0/>, which then evolved into true farming. <a3_0><b7_0>The Natufian period<b7_0/><a3_0/> was between 12,000 and 10,200 BC, and the so-called "proto-Neolithic" is now included in the Pre-Pottery Neolithic (PPNA) between 10,200 and 8,800 BC. As the Natufians had become dependent on wild cereals in their diet, and a sedentary way of life had begun among them, the <b8_0>climatic changes associated with the Younger Dryas<b8_0/> are thought to have forced people to develop farming.
